page.title: 06PHOTOGRAPH STUDY:REFLECTIONS
page.content: One group of students played a major role in deciding what was to be photographed and after the painful task of choosing four slides for inclusion in the Project felt that some mention of the difficulties experienced in photographing was needed. This is a quiet and flat area and so some of the initial guidelines proved difficult to carry out. There are no high vantage points and apart from two tiny shopping areas the streets, mainly of housing, seemed always to be empty. It proved difficult to photograph people at work and no festival existed. Many of the slides were dull and repetitive shots of lonely houses, dull shops, distant motorway or lively corn in huge fields. Nevertheless this was a worthwhile study and gave an insight into and understanding of the area.
